Goal: Maintain an efficient and effective Classification Plan
Performance Measure: Number of position classifications in the Civil Service Plan
Description: Number of job codes/position classifications in the Civil Service Plan.
Technical Description: Collection Method: Data are stored in the City's Human Resources Information System (queried from the ASOXP db using the Job Code Index report. SF_JOB_INDEX_COMMN. Includes Board/Commissioner classes 0110-0118). Timing:  Data are available at any time.
FY 2013 Yr End Actual Explanation: The increase in number of position classifications was due to the elimination of the City's redevelopment agency and the creation of new San Francisco Employees' Retirement System classifications.

Goal: Provide high quality compensation services
Performance Measure: Percent of wage rate calculations not requiring pay corrections
Description: Percent of off-matrix (i.e. manual) salary grade calculations that are calculated correctly and do not result in either underpayment or overpayment of employees. The number of erroneous pay grades under which employees were paid divided by the total number of manually-calculated pay grades in the period.
Technical Description: Collection Method: Staff will track errors; total manual salary grade calculations are available by counting the number of salary grades with alphabetic characters in them. (Matrix grades use only numbers.) Timing:  Will be reported at fiscal year end.
FY 2013 Yr End Actual Explanation: Expertise and thoroughness allows for expectation of 99%.

Goal: All City employees have a current performance appraisal
Performance Measure: # of employees for whom performance appraisals were scheduled
Description: New measure requested by Mayor on 8/15/05.  This is the number of employees in DHR for whom a performance appraisal is to be conducted.  DHR policy is that all permanent and provisional employees must have an annual appraisal.  For new employees, the first review shold be scheduled according to their applicable probationary period.  For other employees, reviews should be conducted every 12 months. Departments can do appraisals for temporary employees at their discretion.
Technical Description: Collection Method: Historically tracked in spreasheet, but moving to new Employee Review panel in the City's Human Resources Information System. Timing:  DHR completes performance appraisals on a calendar year cycle. Data are available within the first quarter of the calendar year.

Goal: All City employees have a current performance appraisal
Performance Measure: # of employees for whom scheduled performance appraisals were completed
Description: New measure requested by Mayor on 8/15/05.  This is the number of applicable employees in DHR for whom a performance appraisal was conducted amd completed during the fiscal year.  "Completed" means an appraisal form has been filled out and is in the employee's personnel file.  DHR policy is that all permanent and provisional employees must have an annual appraisal.  For new employees, the first review shold be scheduled according to their applicable probationary period.  For other employees, reviews should be conducted every 12 months.   Departments can do appraisals for temporary employees at their discretion.
Technical Description: Collection Method: Historically tracked in spreasheet, but moving to new Employee Review panel in the City's Human Resources Information System. Timing:  DHR completes performance appraisals on a calendar year cycle. Data are available within the first quarter of the calendar year.

Goal: Achieve human resources policy objectives
Performance Measure: Percent of identified policy initiatives implemented through MOUs and other mechanisms
Description: The proportion of policy initiatives identified at the start of the fiscal year that are incorporated into labor agreements (MOUs) or adopted through other mechanisms during the year, including ordinances, Charter provisions, Civil Service Rules, and administrative policies and procedures.
Technical Description: Collection Method: Policy goals and initiatives will be set at the beginning of the fiscal year and tracked for implementation. Timing:  Achievement of the goals in a fiscal year will be evaluated at fiscal year end.
FY 2013 Yr End Actual Explanation: All three projects were completed.  1. The City successfully negotiated Substance Abuse Prevention Program Memorandum of Understanding amendments for 10 unions.  2.  Completed the SEIU Recruitment and Retention arbitration process which resulted in no new costs to the City.  3. Implemented "As-Needed" Arbitration Award.  Closed examinations for certain as-needed employees scheduled.
FY 2013 Yr End Dept Comment: 1. Build on gains made on drug testing 2. Successfully conclude SEIU negotiations regarding Recruitment and Retenetion 3. Successfully implement SEIU As Needed Arbitration Award

Goal: Facilitate stable and productive employee-employer relations
Performance Measure: Percent of grievances proceeding to arbitration in which the City prevails
Description: Percent of grievances proceeding to arbitration in which the City prevails
Technical Description: Collection Method: DHR, Employee Relations Division uses Microsoft Excel to track grievances. Each grievance is assigned a unique number, and its resolution is coded in the "disposition" field. Timing:  Data on status of grievances are available at any time.

Goal: Provide City employees with a discrimination-free workplace
Performance Measure: Percentage of discrimination complaints investigated within 6 months of receipt
Description: Complaints completed during the fiscal year and completed within six months of filing. Excludes MTA complaints.
Technical Description: Collection Method: Claimants and Departments report discrimination complaints to DHR.  DHR logs complaints recording the date of filing and assigns the complaints for review and investigation.  Upon completion, the HR Director's resolution of the complaint and date of such resolution is recorded. Timing:  Data on status of current complaints is available at any time.
FY 2013 Yr End Dept Comment: The percentage of discrimination complaints investigated within 6 months of receipt was below the target goal as DHR EEO focused on settling complaints with a finding to minimize liability in exchange for meeting the case closure time frame.  Six cases were successfully settled and two cases were held in abeyance at the request of the City Attorney’s Office due to external administrative or court processes.

Goal: Streamline the examination process to facilitate permanent appointment and maintain low level of provisional appointment
Performance Measure: Average time between examination announcement closing and list adoption, in months
Description: The average (mean) number of calendar days (for all recruitments leading to permanent, civil service employment), representing the time period between the final closing date of a non-continuous recruitment (i.e., a discrete announcement for a job opportunity) and the adoption date of the eligible list produced as a result of that recruitment (from which hires are made).
Technical Description: Collection Method:  An automated applicant and announcement system (JobAps) collects the data, from which reports can be run.  From these reports, the announcement closing date value (i.e., the last date to file an application for the announcement) is subtracted from the list adoption date value (the date the list of qualified eligibles/candidates is made public) and the average number of days is then determined across all lists.  This number is then divided by 30 to convert the time period from days to months.  The measure is typically assessed at the end of each fiscal year.
FY 2013 Yr End Actual Explanation: The average time between examination announcement closing and list adoption is slightly higher than that which was projected. This may be attributable to this year’s transition to the PeopleSoft HR system which shifted the focus of human resource professionals as new business practices were being developed and learned.  Also, the system changeover required that certain personnel transactions already underway involving recruitment and examination activities be delayed.

Goal: Streamline the examination process to facilitate permanent appointment and maintain low level of provisional appointment
Performance Measure: Percentage of employees citywide that are provisional
Description: Percentage of Provisional appointments to total workforce excluding employees with as-needed work schedules.
Technical Description: Collection Method: Human Resources Information System query MRG_TPV_APPTS data divided by query MRG_SUCCESSION_PLAN_DEPT data and SFMTA business units, excluding as-needed employees and employees of the Community College and School Districts. Run query 2 weeks after end of measurement period to include backdated appointment changes, particularly retirements. Note: Civil Service Commission report also excludes provisional appointments in MTA service critical classes. Timing:  Query can be run at any time, but especially at fiscal year end, it is important to wait two weeks after measurement period end to capture retirements and other changes.
FY 2013 Yr End Actual Explanation: Eligible lists were generated for a number of classifications with a particularly large number of provisional employees.   This, and aggressive targeting of other classifications with provisional employees, helped reduce the count to a historical low.   At this point, there are 10 fewer job classifications with provisional employees than there were one year ago.   It demonstrates that production of eligible lists for a select group of classes with high provisional counts can significantly affect the City’s overall percentage of provisional employees.  It also suggests that City analysts responsible for recruitment and selection may be doing better at keeping pace with the need to hire

Goal: Provide a safe and healthy work environment
Performance Measure: Claims per 100 FTEs (full time equivalents)
Description: The number of claims filed per 100 FTEs (full time equivalents) during the measurement period, excluding MTA and future medical claims.
Technical Description: Collection Method: Claims data are stored in VOS, the City's claims management information system. FTE counts are available from Financial Reporting (EIS) 80.001 Labor Report. Timing:  Data are available on an ongoing basis.
FY 2013 Yr End Actual Explanation: City employees filed less claims that projected.

Goal: Resolve employee Workers Compensation claims in a timely and effective manner
Performance Measure: Average rating by departments of their claims administration services (1-5 scale).
Description: Measure implemented in FY04-05:  Percentage of departmental workers' compensation coordinators (WCC) that answer excellent or good, on a 4-point scale (excellent, good, fair or poor).   8/31/05: Changed by DHR to an average satisfaction rating by departments using a 5 point scale, which matches the scale used in other DHR surveys (1=fair, 3=average, 5=excellent).
Technical Description: Collection Method: After the close of the fiscal year, WCC's are asked to complete a brief email survey on the quality of claims administration services (overall, and separately by Workers Compensation Division and the third party administrator).  Timing:  The survey is only conducted at fiscal year end. Data availability depends on timeliness of survey responses, but is generally within 8 weeks of the fiscal year end.
FY 2013 Yr End Actual Explanation: The satisfaction rating decrease is due to unfavorable ratings towards the City's third party administrator.

Goal: Resolve employee Workers Compensation claims in a timely and effective manner
Performance Measure: Workers' Compensation claims closing ratio
Description: Indemnity claims closed as a percentage of new and reopened claims
Technical Description: Collection Method: Include new, reopened and closed claims. Claims data are stored in VOS, the City's claims management information system. Timing:  Data are available at any time.
FY 2013 Yr End Actual Explanation: Due to the implementation of Senate Bill 863, the Department was unable to work on the project that would have brought the closing ratio to 106%.

Goal: All City employees have a current performance appraisal
Performance Measure: Number of City employees for whom appraisals were scheduled
Description: This is the total number of employees in all departments for whom performance appraisals were scheduled.   Definition supplied to departments in February 2006, "New measure requested by Mayor on 8/15/05.  This is the number of employees in a department for whom a performance appraisal is to be conducted.  DHR policy is that all permanent and provisional employees must have an annual appraisal.  For new employees, the first review should be scheduled according to their applicable probationary period.  For other employees, reviews should be conducted every 12 months. Departments can do appraisals for temporary employees at their discretion."
Technical Description: Collection Method: Data collected from individual departments under the program code:   "XXX - Non program," Goal 01, Measure 01. Timing:  November of each year (annually).  Data are collected from departments, who perform appraisals on a variety of evaluation cycles (calendar year, fiscal year, anniversary date) and require different amounts of time to collect data. In order to provide the most complete view, data will be reported annually in November.
FY 2013 Yr End Actual Explanation: Data to be available in November 2013.

Goal: All City employees have a current performance appraisal
Performance Measure: Number of City employees for whom scheduled annual appraisals were completed
Description: This is the total number of applicable employees in all City departments for whom performance appraisals were conducted and completed during the fiscal year.  "Completed" means an appraisal form was filled out and filed in the employee's personnel file.  Definition provided to departments in February 2006, "This is the number of applicable employees in a department for whom a performance appraisal was conducted and completed during the fiscal year.  DHR policy is that all permanent and provisional employees must have an annual appraisal.  For new employees, the first review should be scheduled according to their applicable probationary period.  For other employees, reviews should be conducted every 12 months.   Departments can do appraisals for temporary employees at their discretion."
Technical Description: Collection Method: Data collected from individual departments under the program code:   "XXX - Non program," Goal 01, Measure 02. Timing:  November of each year (annually).  Data are collected from departments, who perform appraisals on a variety of evaluation cycles (calendar year, fiscal year, anniversary date) and require different amounts of time to collect data. In order to provide the most complete view, data will be reported annually in November.
FY 2013 Yr End Actual Explanation: Data to be available in November 2013.

Goal: All City employees have a current performance appraisal
Performance Measure: Percentage of employees for whom scheduled annual appraisals were completed
Description: This is the percentage of the number of applicable employees in all City departments for whom performance appraisals were scheduled and completed during the fiscal year.  "Completed" means an appraisal form was filled out and filed in the employee's personnel file.
Technical Description: Collection Method: Total completed appraisals divided by the number of applicable employees (for whom appraisals were scheduled during the applicable time period).   Data are collected from individual departments under the program code:   "XXX - Non program," Goal 01. Timing:  November of each year (annually).  Data are collected from departments, who perform appraisals on a variety of evaluation cycles (calendar year, fiscal year, anniversary date) and require different amounts of time to collect data. In order to provide the most complete view, data will be reported annually in November.
FY 2013 Yr End Actual Explanation: Data to be available in November 2013.

Goal: Provide high quality training to employees
Performance Measure: Average rating of DHR workshops by participants (1-5 scale)
Description: Average rating on a scale from 1-5 that participants provide at the end of DHR training.
Technical Description: Collection Method: Participant Feedback Worksheet, Question 1 -- "How would you rate the workshop as a whole?" The Worksheet uses a 5-point scale: 1=fair, 3=average, 5=excellent. This Worksheet has been used by the training staff for several years. Timing:  Data are available at any time.
FY 2013 Yr End Actual Explanation: The department provided high quality training to employees by its training staff throughout the year.

Goal: Provide high quality training to employees
Performance Measure: Number of training hours delivered
Description: Number of training hours delivered by DHR staff, DHR online workshops, and through City University. A training hour is equivalent to one person in training for one hour.
Technical Description: Collection Method: Class attendance is recorded in OnTrack, the Workforce Development team's class registration software. Class hours delivered through special assignments are recorded separately. Beginning in Q2 of FY13-14, class attendance will be recorded in the PeopleSoft Enterprise Learning Management System.  The number of attendees and hours per class are multiplied and added to provide total training hours. Enrollment in City University is tracked in Excel. Timing:  DHR data are available three weeks after the end of each quarter. City University figures are available after the enrollment period closes (fall, spring, and summer term). Data for summer and fall terms will be reported in July-December actuals, and data for spring term will be reported in July-June submission.
FY 2013 Yr End Actual Explanation: The department provided high quality training to employees by its training staff and the City University program throughout the year.  The number of training hours delivered increased significantly since last fiscal year due to increased departmental training for 24-Plus, a management skills training program.

Goal: Provide high quality training to employees
Performance Measure: Participants' average rating of usefulness and practicality of DHR workshops to their jobs (1-5 scale)
Description: Average rating on a scale from 1-5 that participants provide at the end of DHR training. This proposed measure identifies training that employees consider useful and practical to their jobs.
Technical Description: Collection Method: Participant Feedback Worksheet:  "How would you rate the usefulness and practicality of this workshop to your job?" The Worksheet uses a 5-point scale: 1=poor, 3=average, 5=excellent. Timing:  Data are available at any time.
FY 2013 Yr End Actual Explanation: The department provided high quality training to employees by its training staff throughout the year.

Goal: Provide high quality training to employees
Description: Supervisors will take an exam before and after the 24-PLUS workshop.  DHR will then measure the percentage of improvement.
Technical Description: 24-PLUS workshop examination

Goal: Maintain high accounting standards
Performance Measure: Number of findings of material weakness in annual audit
Description: Number of audit reports with reportable  material weaknesses.  KPMG year-end audit  and Controller's Office post audits of FAMIS & ADPICS documents.FAMIS is an accounting system used citywide by the City and County of San Francisco. ADPICS is a purchasing system. Purchasing transactions flow from ADPICS into FAMIS.
Technical Description: Collection Method: KPMG Audit Report and Controller's Audit Letter (a letter from auditors to management where any audit issues are addressed)
FY 2013 Yr End Actual Explanation: No material weaknesses were identified during audits.

Goal: Maintain high accounting standards
Performance Measure: Percent of purchase orders created after invoice received

Goal: Maintain high accounting standards
Performance Measure: Percentage of accounts current in premium payments (deliquent less than 60 days)
Description: Changed Feb 07 per BOS Dec 2006 hearing.  All members are current with their premium payments, and delinquencies if any are not for 60 days or more.
Technical Description: Collection Method: PeopleSoft Query  - HSS Office Timing:  Delinquencies are identified on a monthly basis and delinquency notices are mailed monthly.  Accounts are terminated when payments are not received by specified due date.
FY 2013 Yr End Actual Explanation: When rounding HSS achieved 100% on this performance measure.  Delinquencies do occur but through the follow up actions of HSS, these comprise less than 1/10th of one percent.

Goal: Maintain high accounting standards
Performance Measure: Percentage of invoices aged greater than 30 days
Description: City's prompt payment policy requires payment of invoices within 30 days of receipt.  This measure shows the percentage of invoices (voucher payables) older than 30 days.
Technical Description: Collection Method: EIS Continuous Monitoring Report "Invoice Aging Against Purchase Orders"

Goal: Manage Health Service vendors to improve care and manage costs
Performance Measure: Percentage of vendor contracts that are current and final for the executed plan year
Description: Percentage of vendor contracts that are final and executed for the current fiscal year
Technical Description: Collection Method: Manual review of contracts - HSS Offices Timing:  Data are available at all times. Contracts include those of medical, dental and vision benefit providers.
FY 2013 Yr End Actual Explanation: HSS recognized an insufficiency in our contracting resources given the expanded complexity of vendor contracts. Two new contracting FTEs have been funded for fiscal year 13-14 to ensure future compliance with this measure.

Goal: Manage Health Service vendors to improve care and manage costs
Performance Measure: Percentage of vendor contracts that include HSS specific performance guarantees
Description: Percentage of vendor contracts with HSS that include performance guarantees
Technical Description: Collection Method: Manual review of contracts - HSS Offices Timing:  Data are available at all times.
FY 2013 Yr End Actual Explanation: All contracts for medical, dental and vision benefits for the current plan year include performance guarantees

Goal: Strive for excellence in member interactions (as measured by established targets)
Performance Measure: Average lobby wait time (in minutes)
Description: Average customer wait time in the lobby.
Technical Description: Collection Method: Member sign-in sheets showing member arrival time and the time HSS staff provided assistance. Records are at HSS Office. Timing:  Sign-in sheets are compiled daily and summarized on a monthly basis.
FY 2013 Yr End Actual Explanation: Effective Jan 1 2013, HSS moved to providing benefits based on a plan year vs. a fiscal year.  There were increased office visits as members had questions regarding the changes to a plan year.  During the months of Mar-May, there was an increase in members visiting HSS to prepare for retirement.

Goal: Strive for excellence in member interactions (as measured by established targets)
Performance Measure: Average time to answer telephone calls (in seconds)
Description: Average amount of time to answer telephone calls, in seconds.  Industry standard is less than 30 seconds.
Technical Description: Collection Method: ACD Call Monitoring System prints reports showing the number of calls received for specified period and the average speed to answer. ACD Call Monitoring System is scheduled to be replaced latter part of FY06-07 Timing:  Data are available immediately after the end of the reporting date.  Reports are generated at least weekly. 1/28/08.  The ACD Call Monitoring System was replaced in July 2007 with the AVAYA Call Management System and reports are generated monthly. 3/16/09: This metric is the average time callers waited to get an answer from an agent.
FY 2013 Yr End Actual Explanation: Avg Time to answer calls spiked dramatically in Jan & Feb due to the Jan 1 plan year United Health Care conversion to EGWP Pharmacy benefit and due to CalSTRS 12/31 missed deductions.  Call volume was 10 times normal.  During the last quarter of the fiscal year, performance exceeded target.

Goal: Strive for excellence in member interactions (as measured by established targets)
Performance Measure: Call abandonment rate
Description: Call abandonment rate.  Industry standard is less than 5%.
Technical Description: Collection Method: ACD Call Monitoring System prints reports showing the number of calls abandoned.  ACD Call Monitoring System with Data available immedicately  after the end of the reporting period.  Reports are generated at least weekly. 1/28/08: The ACD Call Monitoring System was replaced by AVAYA Call Management System in July 2007 and reports are generated monthly. 3/16/09: Abandonment rate is the percentage of callers who hang up before receiving an answer.
FY 2013 Yr End Actual Explanation: Call volume was significantly higher in January and February (leading to a spike in the abandonment rate) due to the UHC conversion to the EGWP Pharmacy benefit.

Goal: Strive for excellence in member interactions (as measured by established targets)
Performance Measure: Percentage  of appeals responded to within 30 days and appeals not reaching the Health Service Board
Description: Changed Feb 07 per BOS Dec 2006 hearing.
Technical Description: Collection Method: Manual Log at HSS Office Timing:  Appeals are logged as received, staff works on research and resolution and logs appropriate date(s).  Data is compiled as received.  Appeals can include areas of eligibility, benefit coverage, and benefit payments.
FY 2013 Yr End Actual Explanation: HSS performance exceeds target.

Goal: Strive for excellence in member interactions (as measured by established targets)
Performance Measure: Percentage HSS Participation at SFERS Retirement Seminars
Description: Count of times HSS staff attended SFERS Retirement seminars when HSS are scheduled to make presentations.
Technical Description: Collection Method: Manual Log of scheduled SFERS Retirement Seminars when HSS is scheduled to make presentations Timing:  Data available at all times
FY 2013 Yr End Actual Explanation: HSS had 100% participation in SFERS seminars.

Goal: Strive for excellence in member interactions (as measured by established targets)
Performance Measure: Percentage of staff who are bilingual
Description: Maintain a good level of staff who are bilingual to support members language needs.
Technical Description: Collection Method: Count of staff who are bilingual Timing:  Data available all the time
FY 2013 Yr End Actual Explanation: While 49% of the total department are bilingual, 58% of HSS' Operations staff (who deal with our members directly) are bilingual. Languages spoken include Chinese, Burmese, Russian, Ukranian, Vietnamese, Tagalog, English & Spanish

Goal: Ensure staff safety in all departmental facilities
Performance Measure: Average daily population of staff out on workers compensation
Description: The Juvenile Probation Department has embarked on a process to reduce our workers compensation costs.  This measure will assist us in determine our success of reducing this cost.
Technical Description: Twice/year, the Juvenile Probation Human Resource Department will report on the number of staff out on workers compensation and the total number of staff currently employed by the department.
FY 2013 Yr End Actual Explanation: The number of staff on worker's compensation is consistent with previous periods. However JPD does not anticipate an increase in staff on worker's compensation.

Goal: Provide needed staffing for JPD's two residential services
Performance Measure: Number of candidates in the counselor work pool for Juvenile Hall and Log Cabin Ranch
Description: Having a sufficient number of available temporary counselors helps ensure institutional post positions are filled when vacancies occur at the lowest possible cost.  Temporary staff cost half of the cost of permanent counselors at top step earning overtime.
Technical Description: Collection Method: The Personnel clerical staff maintain a list of eligible counselor staff for Juvenile Hall and Log Cabin Ranch who have met minimum staff requirements. Located within Department Personnel Office. Timing:  As-needed report is maintained on a bi-weekly basis.
FY 2013 Yr End Actual Explanation: JPD is working to decrease a need for on-call staff.

Goal: Reduce overtime expenditures in the entire department
Performance Measure: Annual overtime expenditures
Description: This measures the dollar amount the department spends on overtime each year.
Technical Description: Collection Method: Controller issues BRPEP reports that show annual results.  Department prepares monthly reports, extracting information from FAMIS, Controller BPREP reports and Department reports. Timing:  Data is tracked on Famis and TESS..
FY 2013 Yr End Actual Explanation: Overtime expenditures:  Expenditures continued to be high, as a result of minimum staffing needs and the lag in hiring permanent counselors for both Juvenile Hall and Log Cabin Ranch, JPD’s overtime has continued to increase in the latter half of FY12-13.  JPD is now in the process of hiring twelve permanent counselors and expects overtime expenditures to decrease in FY13-14.

Goal: Reduce overtime expenditures in the entire department
Performance Measure: Number of overtime hours incurred in Juvenile Hall
Description: This tracks the number of overtime hours incurred in Juvenile Hall.
Technical Description: Collection Method: The Payroll section collects the data from the employees' timesheets and TESS. Timing:  OT Report is maintained on a bi-weekly basis.
FY 2013 Yr End Actual Explanation: Overtime Hours:  As a result of minimum staffing needs and the lag in hiring permanent counselors for Juvenile Hall, JPD’s overtime hours in Juvenile Hall has continued to increase in the latter half of FY12-13.  JPD is now in the process of hiring twelve permanent counselors and expects overtime hours to decrease in FY13-14.

Performance Measure: # of employees for whom performance appraisals were scheduled
Description: New measure requested by Mayor on 8/15/05.  This is the number of employees in a department for whom a performance appraisal is to be conducted.  DHR policy is that all permanent and provisional employees must have an annual appraisal.  For new employees, the first review shold be scheduled according to their applicable probationary period.  For other employees, reviews should be conducted every 12 months. Departments can do appraisals for temporary employees at their discretion.  Appraisals are not due until Q3 of each fiscal year.
Technical Description: Completed performance appraisals are kept in the individual employee file in the Personnel Unit of the department.
FY 2013 Yr End Actual Explanation: All employees were required to have PA done by end of fiscal year.

Goal: All City employees have a current performance appraisal
Performance Measure: # of employees for whom scheduled performance appraisals were completed
Description: New measure requested by Mayor on 8/15/05.  This is the number of applicable employees in a department for whom a performance appraisal was conducted amd completed during the fiscal year.  "Completed" means an appraisal form has been filled out and is in the employee's personnel file.  DHR policy is that all permanent and provisional employees must have an annual appraisal.  For new employees, the first review should be scheduled according to their applicable probationary period.  For other employees, reviews should be conducted every 12 months.   Departments can do appraisals for temporary employees at their discretion.  Appraisals are not due until Q3 of each fiscal year.
Technical Description: Completed performance appraisals are kept in the individual employee file in the Personnel Unit of the department.
FY 2013 Yr End Actual Explanation: A larger number of supervisors completed appraisals for their staff than last year.  Managers ensured appraisals were completed by then end of the year.

Goal: Provide a safe and secure environment for staff and detainees
Performance Measure: Cost per youth per day - Juvenile Hall

Goal: Provide a safe and secure environment for staff and detainees
Performance Measure: Percent of Juvenile Justice Center youth grievances processed within two business days after filing
Description: Providing a safe and secure environment for youth detained in the Juvenile Justice Center is important.  By processing youth grievances in a timely manner, small problems will be kept from becoming large problems and can be solved quickly.
Technical Description: The Juvenile Probation Department ombudsman provides a monthly report to the Department's Finance/HR units.
FY 2013 Yr End Actual Explanation: JJC youth grievances processed within 2 days:  JPD’s Ombudsman does not review grievances daily, so there is a built-in lag in processing.   The latter half of FY12-13 saw a slight improvement in the percentage of grievances processed within two business days.

Goal: Provide a safe and secure environment for staff and detainees
Performance Measure: Percentage of all assaults involving injury to staff
Description: The Juvenile Justice Center is designed to provide short-term, secure detention for adolescents who present a public safety and/or flight risk while their case proceeds through the juvenile justice system.  Providing a safe and secure setting for the staff to work with these adolescents is a key goal for JPD.
Technical Description: Monthly, Juvenile Justice Center staff report to the Juvenile Probation IT director on all assault.  This PM measures assaults involving staff that require staff hospitalization due to injury.  The Juvenile Hall Director maintains monthly logs as part of the requirements of the State Board of Corrections.
FY 2013 Yr End Dept Comment: JJC has maintained the same level of incidents over the fiscal year.

Goal: Provide a safe and secure environment for staff and detainees
Performance Measure: Percentage of all assaults involving serious injury to youth
Description: The Juvenile Justice Center is designed as a short-term facility for adolescents who pose a public safety or flight risk while their case is proceeding through the juvenile justice system.  Providing these adolescents with a safe and secure setting is of utmost importance.
Technical Description: Juvenile Justice staff, on a monthly basis, reports on all assaults which occur.  This PM focuses on youth who require hospitalization due to an assault involving in jury.  This information is kept by the Juvenile Hall Director as part of the information required by the State Board of Corrections.
FY 2013 Yr End Actual Explanation: JJC has maintained the same level of incidents over the fiscal year.

Goal: Improve results for residents placed at Log Cabin Ranch
Performance Measure: Cost per youth per day - Log Cabin Ranch

Goal: Improve results for residents placed at Log Cabin Ranch
Performance Measure: Percentage of Log Cabin Ranch graduates employed within 60 days of release
Description: Employment upon graduating from Log Cabin Ranch is one of the most important ingredients of a successful aftercare program.
Technical Description: Log Cabin Ranch Probation Officer will report on the status of all Log Cabin Graduates on a monthly basis. The numerator includes only graduates employed within 60 days of release and does not include graduates who attend school because they are too young to work.
FY 2013 Yr End Actual Explanation: There was an increase due to enhanced aftercare services with increased focus on obtaining employment

Goal: Improve results for residents placed at Log Cabin Ranch
Performance Measure: Percentage of Log Cabin Ranch graduates enrolled in vocational or educational programs within 30 days of release
Description: Juvenile Probation is intensifying its after-care program for juveniles enrolled at Log Cabin Ranch.  Providing these young men with placement in a vocational or education program upon release is a key determinant for the success of these young men.
Technical Description: Twice/year, (July - Dec.) and Jan. - June), LCR staff will provide the JPD IT staff with this information.  IT will then produce two semi-annual reports regarding this measure.
FY 2013 Yr End Actual Explanation: There was an increase due to enhanced aftercare services with focus on vocational and educational program participation

Goal: Improve results for residents placed at Log Cabin Ranch
Performance Measure: Percentage of Log Cabin Ranch graduates who do not incur sustained charges for new law violations within the first year of graduation
Description: A major goal of the Juvenile Probation Department is to reduce recidivism of the juveniles it serves.  This measure will provide guidance as to the success of Log Cabin Ranch juveniles.
Technical Description: Twice/year, the Log Cabin Ranch staff will provide reports to the Juvenile Probation IT staff of all youth who graduated.  JPD staff will then analyze if any of these have had a sustained charge for a new law violation.
FY 2013 Yr End Actual Explanation: It is possible more youth did not sustain new charges because of increased level of aftercare services and probation monitoring.

Goal: Improve the quality of customer service to youth and their families
Performance Measure: Percentage of grievances processed within three business days after grievance is filed
Description: A written grievance may include but is not limited to complaints about the food, quality of institutional care, or personal rights from detainees.  All grievances are considered important and are investigated to determine appropriate follow-up.
Technical Description: Collection Method: The ombudsman receives grievances and tracks processing times. The ombudsman maintains grievance files and reports results to LCR Director and to the Chief and Assistant Chief Probation Officers. Timing:  The ombudsman maintains grievance files and reports results to LCR Director and to the Chief and Assistant Chief Probation Officers.
FY 2013 Yr End Actual Explanation: LCR grievances:  There were no grievances filed for Log Cabin during the reporting period.

Goal: Reduce repeat offenders
Performance Measure: Percentage of youth on who incur a sustained finding for a technical violation while on probation
Description: This measures the percentage of youth on probation who commit a technical violation.   A technical violation may be one but not limited to the following:   violate a specific court order, stay away order, curfew, attend school and drug-testing.
Technical Description: Collection Method: Data is tracked in the Juvenile Justice Information System. Timing:  Juvenile Justice Information System Ad-hoc Reports and JPD monthly report.
FY 2013 Yr End Actual Explanation: This number has remained consistent over the year. JPD continues to link youth with services that allow them to be successful while on probation.

Goal: Reduce repeat offenders
Performance Measure: Percentage of youth who incur a sustained finding for a new law violation while on probation
Description: This measures the percentage of youth with a new sustained petition while on probation.
Technical Description: Collection Method: Data is tracked in the Juvenile Justice Information System. Timing:  Juvenile Justice Information System Ad-hoc Reports.
FY 2013 Yr End Actual Explanation: This number has remained consistent over the year. JPD continues to link youth with services that allow them to be successful while on probation.

Goal: Successful Completion of Probation
Performance Measure: Average length of stay (in days) from disposition to placement of youth in juvenile hall awaiting out of home placement
Description: This is a calculation of the number of days the youth spends in Juvenile Hall  from the time the court orders out-of-home placement to actual placement.     Prior years' data was a calculation of the number of days from detention in Juvenile Hall to actual placement.
Technical Description: Collection Method: Data is tracked in the Juvenile Justice Information Sytem(JJIS).    It is a calculation of the days from court disposition to placement date. Timing:  Juvenile Justice Information System Ad-hoc Reports.
FY 2013 Yr End Actual Explanation: There has been a continued trend to make linkages that allow kids to be sent out of state.

Goal: Successful Completion of Probation
Performance Measure: Percentage of successfully terminated 654 youth compared to the unsuccessful 654 youth
Description: A court order of voluntary probation is known as a 654.  The court is putting more and more youth on voluntary probation than in the past.  The goal of putting a youth on voluntary probation is to give the youth six months to be crime-free and to follow orders of the court and the probation officer.  if, after six months, the youth has successfully completed the orders, the judge will dismiss the charge.
Technical Description: This performance measure will be determined twice/year, covering the time periods July - December and January - June.  Juvenile Probation staff will input this information and the IT department will do a report twice/year listed all youth put on voluntary probation and the results of this process.
FY 2013 Yr End Actual Explanation: There has been a shift in judges and there may be a greater number of inappropriate kids placed on informal probation.

Goal: Successful Completion of Probation
Performance Measure: Percentage of successfully terminated 725A youth compared to the unsuccessful 725A youth
Description: 725a is the section of the law code which refers to youth whose lives have touched both the juvenile justice and dependancy system.  A 725a order is very similar to an order of voluntary probation.  This performance measure will provide with guidance for this population of adolescents.
Technical Description: We will measure the success of these youth twice/year:  July - December and January - June.  Juveniel Probation staff will input this information and the IT staff will run a report twice/year listing all youth who have been given a 725A status and the results of this order.
FY 2013 Yr End Actual Explanation: JPD continues to work with HSA to collaborate in order to use alternatives to detention.

Goal: Utilize probation services and community resources to assist youth in successfully navigating probation.
Performance Measure: Percent of authorized Intensive Supervision and Clinical Services slots utilized by eligible youth
Description: Percentage of authorized Intensive Home-bassed Supervision slots utilized by eligible youth.  The Community partners providing contract work for the department agree to provide a set number of program slots each year (units of service).  This is a measurement of how many of these slots are actually used.  Youth are referred to program services based on their service needs, age, residency, interest. and criminogenic factors.
Technical Description: Collection Method: The community agencies that provide Intensive Home-based Services submit reports to DPH (who contracts with these agencies).  The number of utilized program slots is incorporated into these reports. This information is maintained in the DPH Data Basse.
FY 2013 Yr End Actual Explanation: ISCS providers exceeded their expected service capacity during this period.

Goal: Utilize probation services and community resources to assist youth in successfully navigating probation.
Performance Measure: Percentage of Early Morning Studies Academy (EMSA) youth who complete GED
Description: This measures the % of youth who complete GED with 12 months from the start of participation.
Technical Description: Collection Method: Data is maintained in the Contract Management System. Timing:  Contract Management System Ad-hoc reports.
FY 2013 Yr End Actual Explanation: Graduation occurred on May 28, 2013 at which time we graduated 37 of the 51 Court and SFUSD County Day School students.

Goal: Utilize probation services and community resources to assist youth in successfully navigating probation.
Performance Measure: Percentage of probationer applicants through the New Directions Employment Program who get jobs compared with those who have applied
Description: One of the primary factors to reduce crimogenic risk is to provide adolescents with jobs.
Technical Description: The New Directions Employment Program staff will track on a semi-annual basis the number of probation youth who have applied for jobs and the number who have gotten jobs.
FY 2013 Yr End Actual Explanation: Success Center SF provided over 1300 job readiness training hours to 78 youth this program year.  Among them 48 were placed into employment.  SCSF was  not successful in its application with DCYF to continue to serve at the department’s intermediary for job readiness and placement services but was selected by the Mayor’s Office of Economic and Workforce Development and the Mayor’s Summer Jobs Plus Program to service as community access point for connecting youth to employment based on our expertise and success with this population

Goal: Utilize probation services and community resources to assist youth in successfully navigating probation.
Performance Measure: Percentage of youth who successfully complete the Evening Report Center Programs
Description: Evening Reporting Centers are a key component of Juvenile Probation's Alternative-to-Detention efforts.
Technical Description: JDAI Coordinator monitors the completion rate of the Evening Reporting Centers on a monthly basis and will report on a six-month basis, twice/year.
FY 2013 Yr End Actual Explanation: Actuals for 1/1/13 to 6/30/13: 68% of the youth served by the ERCs successfully graduated from the program (26 out of 38).  This percentage falls between our range in the past of 66% - 75% success rate.  Please note that success is defined as completing the 6 week ERC curriculum while remaining arrest free and attending every court date.

Goal: Utilize probation services and community resources to assist youth in successfully navigating probation.
Performance Measure: Total number of community service hours completed by probation involved youth
Description: Community service is a cornerstone of restorative justice.  These adolescents give back to the community and learn by working with others
Technical Description: The community service staff provides semi-annual data on both the number of youth who performed community service and the number of community service hours performed
FY 2013 Yr End Actual Explanation: BT relies on referrals from the aforementioned sources.  We have seen a dramatic increase in the number of completers give our strength based educational approach to service learning. 209 youth were referred to services assigned to over 7700 community service hours.  In the last half of the year, 5489 hours were completed

Goal: Ensure customer satisfaction with services at the branch libraries
Performance Measure: How patrons rate the quality of library staff assistance in the branch libraries and Bookmobiles on a scale of 1-10
Description: How patrons rate the quality of library staff assistance in the branch libraries and Bookmobiles on a scale of 1-10.
Technical Description: Collection Method: Survey posted on the Library's web site since February 2008.  Chief of Branches Office.  Timing: Survey conducted 24/7 throughout the year.  Results immediately available.
FY 2013 Yr End Actual Explanation: Patron rating is higher than expected due to the quality of service provided by branch staff and the emphasis on customer-focused service, training, and coaching.

Goal: Ensure customer satisfaction with services at the branch libraries
Performance Measure: Number of questions answered annually at the branch libraries including Bookmobiles, Log Cabin Ranch and Juvenile Jutices Center
Description: Number of questions answered annually at the branch libraries including Bookmobiles, Log Cabin Ranch and Juvenile Justice Center
Technical Description: Collection Method: Survey on  number of questions asked at service desks during sample time periods; Chief of Branches Office. Timing:  Survey conducted semi-annually in September and March.  Results available in October and April.
FY 2013 Yr End Actual Explanation: Number of questions answered at the branch libraries surpassed the goal by 16% which can be attributed to the increase of patrons and the opening of the new Bayview Branch Library.

Goal: Ensure customer satisfaction with services at the branch libraries
Performance Measure: Percentage of San Franciscans who rate the quality of assistance from staff as good or very good (biennial City Survey)
Description: Percentage of San Francisco residents who reported "good" or "very good" to question "In general, how do you rate the City's libraries on assistance from library staff" as part of a mail and telephone citizen survey.
Technical Description: Collection Method: Citizen survey conducted by the Controller's Office.  Mail and telephone surveys are conducted between January-February and results are reported in early spring. 5,500 mail surveys are sent out and roughly 400 telephone interviews are conducted.  Documentation is located within the Controller's Office. Timing:  To be determined by Controller's Office (currently done every 2 years)
FY 2013 Yr End Actual Explanation: Exceeded goal.  Patrons reported high satisfaction with the quality of staff assistance in our branch libraries.

Goal: Ensure that all library facilities are safe, accessible and sustainable public spaces
Performance Measure: Percentage of branch libraries that are seismically upgraded, moved from leased to permanent spaces, and made ADA compliant
Description: Percentage of all branch libraries that are seismically upgraded, moved from leased to permanent spaces, and made ADA compliant.  This is being accomplished as a result of the Branch Library Inprovement Program (BLIP) and other state and city funded programs.  Refreshed furniture and fixtures are also included.
Technical Description: Collection Method: Count in determined based on date new and renovated facilities are open to the public.  Chief of Branches Office. Timing:  Reports are generated semi-annually.
FY 2013 Yr End Actual Explanation: North Beach Branch Library is the only branch library that is not ADA compliant nor seismically upgraded; the new building is scheduled to open by early 2014.

Goal: Meet citizens' needs in quantity and availability of library collections at the branch libraries
Performance Measure: In-library use of materials at branch libraries
Description: Use of books and other materials within the branch libraries that are not checked out.
Technical Description: Collection Method: Sample survey conducted semi-annually; Chief of Branches Office. Timing:  Survey conducted during October and March every year.  Results available in November and April.
FY 2013 Yr End Actual Explanation: In-library use of materials surpassed the goal by 3.8% than targeted.  The Branch libraries continue to be used for research and reading centers which are equally important uses of libraries.

Goal: Provide hours of operation at the branch libraries that respond to user demand
Performance Measure: Number of persons entering branch libraries including Bookmobiles, Log Cabin Ranch and Juvenile Justice Center
Description: Number of persons entering branch libraries including Bookmobiles, Log Cabin Ranch and Juvenile Justice Center
Technical Description: Collection Method: Sample survey results plus people counter tabulations are combined to determine the number of persons entering the branch libraries. (People counters are located at approximately half of the branches); Chief of Branches Office. Timing:  Sample surveys are  conducted semi-annually in October and April for those branches without people counters.  People counter results are tabulated in January and July.
FY 2013 Yr End Actual Explanation: The increase in the number of branch visits by patrons exceeded the goal by 3.4%, which can be attributed to new and renovated facilities as a result of the Branch Library Improvement Program.  The welcoming facilities and the quality customer service from branch staff contribute towards the increase of patrons coming to branch libraries.

Goal: Provide hours of operation at the branch libraries that respond to user demand
Performance Measure: Weekly hours of operation in the branch libraries including Bookmobiles, Log Cabin Ranch and Juvenile Justice Center
Description: Weekly hours of operation in the branch libraries including Bookmobiles, Log Cabin Ranch and Juvenile Justice Center
Technical Description: Collection Method: Sum of hours of operation for each open branch library and bookmobile service per week; Chief of Branches Office. Timing:  Public hearings will be held no later than March 1, 2013, as established by the renewal of the Library Preservation Fund in 2008. Data reports are generated monthly.
FY 2013 Yr End Actual Explanation: Branch operating hours total 1321 hours/ week exceeding the requirements of the Library Preservation Fund by 3.36%. The additional reported hours include expanding hours at Portola, Mission Bay, and Visitacion Valley; Mobile Outreach Service (Bookmobiles); the Juvenile Correction Center; and Log Cabin Ranch operating hours.

Goal: Provide high quality programs for children and youth
Performance Measure: Number of children and youth attending programs
Description: Number of particpants who attend library programs for children and youth (birth through 18 years).  Includes story times, media programs, special programs, teen programs, Summer Reading, and Kid Power.
Technical Description: Collection Method: Staff count; Office of Children & Youth Services. Timing:  Reports are generated twice yearly in August and January.
FY 2013 Yr End Actual Explanation: Year end actual is 101% of target reflecting the reality of the expected stabilization due to the winding down of post renovation branch reopenings, while at the same time showing continued due to the continued commitment to providing a rich array of educational and cultural programs throughout the City's neighborhoods.

Goal: Provide high quality programs for children and youth
Performance Measure: Number of programs provided
Description: Number of programs provided by the library for children (birth through 18 years) and their families and care providers.  Includes story times, media programs, special programs, teen programs, Summer Reading, and Kid Power.
Technical Description: Collection Method: Staff count; Office of Children & Youth Services. Timing:  Reports are generated twice yearly in August and January.
FY 2013 Yr End Actual Explanation: The year end actual was 108% of target.  This reflects the continued commitment to the Library's role as a cultural and educational hub for the City neighborhoods, including an increased focus on homework and reading help programs throughout the system which increased 98% over the previous year.

Goal: Support early literacy through "Every Child Ready to Read" (ECRR) program
Performance Measure: Number of caregiver/parent participants in ECRR trainings and workshops
Description: Number of caregiver/parent participants in "Every Child Ready to Read" (national early literacy program)  trainings and workshops.
Technical Description: Collection Method: Staff count; Office of Children & Youth Services. Timing:  Reports compiled annually and available in July.
FY 2013 Yr End Actual Explanation: Year end actual for parents and caregivers participating in early literacy workshops was 104% of target (a 38% increase over target of previous year and 22% increase over FY 12 actual).  These figures reflect the program shift from single program provider to branch level workshops supported by presentation resources developed and made available to staff with the objective of positioning every children's librarian in the City's neighborhoods as an early literacy resource for that neighborhood.

Goal: Support early literacy through "Every Child Ready to Read" (ECRR) program
Performance Measure: Percentage of caregiver/parent participants who rate ECRR trainings and workshops as important in fostering early literacy
Description: Percentage of caregiver/parent participants who rate "Every Child Ready to Read" (national early literacy program) trainings and workshops as important in fostering early literacy.
Technical Description: Collection Method: Survey conducted by staff; Office of Children & Youth Services. Timing:  Reports will be generated annually with results available in June.
FY 2013 Yr End Actual Explanation: Year end actual for parents and caregivers participating in Every Child Ready to Read workshops who rate the trainings as important in fostering early literacy is at 100% of goal.  This has been a consistent number over the past few years, and reflects the programs quality, ability to impart early literacy concepts and the attendees satisfaction with what they learn as well as staff commitment to this program as part of the City Librarian's Learning & Literacy priority.

Goal: Support education of children and youth through instruction on library resources and how to use them
Performance Measure: Number of children and teens receiving instruction via school visits or library visits
Description: Number of children and teens receiving instruction on use of library resources by either a librarian visiting their class at school or their class coming to the library.
Technical Description: Collection Method: Staff count; Office of Children & Youth Services. Timing:  Reports are generated twice yearly in August and January.
FY 2013 Yr End Actual Explanation: Year end actual for students receiving library, literacy and research instruction from children and teen services librarians is 105% of target (target was a 10% increase over previous year).  This reflects the Library's continued commitment to school outreach and support as part of the SFUSD Partnership for Achievement.

Goal: Support education of children and youth through instruction on library resources and how to use them
Performance Measure: Number of instructional visits or programs for school classes
Description: Visits by children's and teen librarians to area schools or visits by school classes to libraries for instruction on library resources and how to use them in support of homework and research.
Technical Description: Collection Method: Staff count; Office of Children & Youth Services. Timing:  Reports are generated twice yearly in August and January.
FY 2013 Yr End Actual Explanation: Year end actual for visits to classes and class visits to the Library for library, literacy and research instruction is 108.9% of target(which was a 2.5% increase over the previous year).  This reflects the Library's continued commitment to supporting student success as part of the SFUSD Partnership for Achievement which is part of the City Librarian's Learning & Literacy priority. This priority places strong emphasis on children and teen services librarians working with principals and teachers to educate them and their students about resources and services that help support students.

Goal: Support education of children and youth through instruction on library resources and how to use them
Performance Measure: Percentage of participants who rate instructional visits or programs for school classes as good or very good
Description: Percentage of participants (school teachers and students) who reported "good" or "very good" to the question "How do you rate the instructional visits or programs for school classes?" as part of the Office of Children and Youth Services survey.
Technical Description: Collection Method: Survey conducted by staff; Office of Children & Youth Services. Timing:  Reports generated annually in March and available in April.
FY 2013 Yr End Actual Explanation: Year end actual for class instruction participants who rated instructional visits as good or very good was 97.9% of target, just under the 99% goal.  This annual evaluation has consistently exhibited a minor 2% - 4% variation.  The Library will continue to work to reach and maintain a 99% rating by those students receiving instruction.

Goal: Acquire, prepare and maintain library materials for public use
Performance Measure: Number of new materials made available to the public
Description: Number of library materials (books and audiovisual materials) cataloged, processed, and inventoried.
Technical Description: Collection Method: Statistics compiled by Technical Services staff. Timing:  Reports are generated monthly.
FY 2013 Yr End Actual Explanation: FY13 acquisitions of tangible materials showed an 8% drop over FY12, indicating along with usage measures the continued migration from print to electronic formats.

Goal: Ensure access to materials and services for patrons who speak/read a language other than English
Performance Measure: Number of physical items in languages other than English added to the library's collection
Description: Number of library materials (books and audiovisual materials) in languages other than English added to the library's collection.
Technical Description: Collection Method: Statistics compiled by Technical Services staff. Timing:  Reports are generated twice a year.
FY 2013 Yr End Actual Explanation: Actuals exceeded FY13 target by 5% and exceeded FY12 actuals by 6%, showing a healthy increase in a high-demand category of library materials.

Goal: Meet citizens' needs in quantity and availability of library collections
Performance Measure: Circulation of eBooks and eMedia
Description: Number of items (eBooks/eMedia) circulated to the public (children, youth and adults) system-wide.
Technical Description: Collection Method: Statistics generated from the Library’s automated circulation system; Information Technology and Collections & Technical Services Divisions.  Timing: Reports are generated monthly.
FY 2013 Yr End Actual Explanation: The Library's target was exceeded by 27% and its projection by 1%. FY13 actuals represent a 47% increase over FY12 actuals as eBook use continues to climb in both the consumer and library markets.

Goal: Meet citizens' needs in quantity and availability of library collections
Performance Measure: Circulation of physical books and materials
Description: Number of items (physical books/materials) circulated to the public (children, youth and adults) system-wide.
Technical Description: Collection Method: Statistics generated from the Library’s automated circulation system; Information Technology and Collections & Technical Services Divisions.  Timing: Reports are generated monthly.
FY 2013 Yr End Actual Explanation: Library's projection was accurate, showing a 3.3% decrease in tangible circulation over FY12 and indicating a continued migration from print to electronic formats.  Interestingly, the rate of circulation was steady for the second half of the year which may indicate a stabilization of the drop.

Goal: Provide access to quality online computer resources and databases
Performance Measure: How patrons rate the quality of library databases on a scale of 1-10
Description: How patrons rate the quality of library databases on a scale of 1-10
Technical Description: Collection Method: Survey posted on the Library's web site since February 2008; Communications, Collections & Adult Services Office.  Timing: Survey conducted 24/7 throughout the year.  Results immediately available.
FY 2013 Yr End Actual Explanation: Library's performance was very slightly - 1.8% -lower than target.  The Library has increased public training in how to use eBook devices and platforms to address the complexity of these technologies and assist new users.

Goal: Provide access to quality online computer resources and databases
Performance Measure: Number of uses of the Library's subscription databases by staff and public
Description: Number of searches done by staff and users on licensed database purchased by the library.
Technical Description: Collection Method: Vendor-supplied database usage reports are used to summarize total number of searches for all databases.  For vendors who do not supply statistics on "searches," the total number of "retrievals" or "access" is used instead.  Collection Development Office Database Librarian gathers statistics from vendors, enters statistics into spreadsheet, and summaries are posted on the Library's staff website, Staffnet. Timing:  Reports are generated  monthly.
FY 2013 Yr End Actual Explanation: Strong performance in eBook and eMedia checkouts was balanced by a reduction in the use of some online reference resources.  Overall uses were 7.5 percent fewer than in FY12, but 24% higher than target.

Goal: Provide beneficial uses for materials no longer needed by the library
Performance Measure: Number of books and library materials distributed to community groups for public benefit purposes
Description: Number of books and library materials distributed to community groups.
Technical Description: Collection Method: Hand count of boxes of materials distributed to community groups.  Adult Services/Redistribution Program. Timing:  Redistributed books are logged as they are picked up.   Statistics are generated quarterly.
FY 2013 Yr End Actual Explanation: The Library exceeded its target by 50% as usage of the program by local organizations increased.

Goal: Provide high quality collections and resources
Performance Measure: How patrons rate the quality of library collections on a scale of 1-10
Description: How patrons rate the quality of library collections on a scale of 1-10
Technical Description: Collection Method: Survey posted on the Library's web site since February 2008.  Communications, Collections & Adult Services Office.  Timing: Survey conducted 24/7 throughout the year.  Results immediately available.
FY 2013 Yr End Actual Explanation: The Library achieved a 5.5 percent increase over its target and over its FY12 performance. Possible factors could be the increased number of publishers lending eBooks to libraries plus a continued strong materials budget for all formats.

Goal: Provide high quality collections and resources
Performance Measure: Percentage of San Franciscans who rate the quality of the library's collections as good or very good (biennial City Survey)
Description: Percentage of San Francisco residents who reported "good" or "very good" to question "In general, how do you rate the City's libraries on quality of collections of books, tapes, etc?" as part of a mail and telephone citizen survey.
Technical Description: Collection Method: Citizen survey conducted by the Controller's Office.  Mail and telephone surveys are conducted between January-February and results are reported in early spring. 5,500 mail surveys are sent out and roughly 400 telephone interviews are conducted.  Documentation is located within the Controller's Office. Timing:  To be determined by Controller's Office (currently done every 2 years).
FY 2013 Yr End Actual Explanation: While not quite reaching its target, the Library saw a two percentage point increase in this measure over the previous survey.

Goal: Ensure access to materials and services for patrons who speak/read a language other than English
Performance Measure: Attendance at public programs and trainings offered for speakers of languages other than English
Description: Number of people attending public programs offered in languages other than English.
Technical Description: Collection Method: Staff count of attendees; Public Affairs Office within the CCAS Division. Timing:  Program evaluation forms are filled out by the sponsoring librarian following a public program. Public Affairs office collects the data and compiles it monthly.
FY 2013 Yr End Actual Explanation: Attendance at public programs for speakers of languages other than English remained strong in the second half  of FY 12-13.  Last year, SFPL's volunteer coordinator instituted weekly conversational language classes that remain popular.  We also continue to support a robust level of computer training classes in Spanish and Chinese.

Goal: Provide for and inform the public on high quality educational and cultural programs and services offered by the library
Performance Measure: Number of people attending adult programs
Description: Number of people attending adult programs
Technical Description: Collection Method: Staff count of attendees; Communications, Collections & Adult Services Office. Timing:  Statistics reported after each program.  Compiled monthly.
FY 2013 Yr End Actual Explanation: Attendance increased in the second half of the fiscal year. Key events included the grand opening of the new Bayview Branch Library, and large scale, popular exhibition events for We Live Here and Dancing in the Dragon's Jaws. In addition, a strong level of adult programming at the branches led to significant attendance increases.

Goal: All City employees have a current performance appraisal
Performance Measure: # of employees for whom performance appraisals were scheduled
Description: New measure requested by Mayor on 8/15/05.  This is the number of employees in a department for whom a performance appraisal is to be conducted.  DHR policy is that all permanent and provisional employees must have an annual appraisal.  For new employees, the first review shold be scheduled according to their applicable probationary period.  For other employees, reviews should be conducted every 12 months. Departments can do appraisals for temporary employees at their discretion.
Technical Description: Collection Method: New measure requested by Mayor on 8/15/05.  This is the number of employees in a department for whom a performance appraisal is to be conducted.  DHR policy is that all permanent and provisional employees must have an annual appraisal.  For new employees, the first review should be scheduled according to their applicable probationary period.  For other employees, reviews should be conducted every 12 months. Departments can do appraisals for temporary employees at their discretion. Timing:  Data is provided daily; reports may be generated upon request.
FY 2013 Yr End Actual Explanation: Due to the filling of a number of vacancies during the fiscal year, there was an increase of total staff requiring performance appraisals by 93 persons (12.7%).  Each year this number fluctuates due to budgetary fluctuations and organizational priorities.

Goal: All City employees have a current performance appraisal
Performance Measure: # of employees for whom scheduled performance appraisals were completed
Description: New measure requested by Mayor on 8/15/05.  This is the number of applicable employees in a department for whom a performance appraisal was conducted amd completed during the fiscal year.  "Completed" means an appraisal form has been filled out and is in the employee's personnel file.  DHR policy is that all permanent and provisional employees must have an annual appraisal.  For new employees, the first review should be scheduled according to their applicable probationary period.  For other employees, reviews should be conducted every 12 months.   Departments can do appraisals for temporary employees at their discretion.
Technical Description: Collection Method: Performance Appraisals (PA) are maintained in the Library's HR Division PA database.  PA database tracks by worksite and anniversary date. Timing:  Data is provided daily; reports may be generated upon request.
FY 2013 Yr End Actual Explanation: "Overall, we were able to increase our percentage of completed performance appraisals in the last six months of the fiscal year by 9%, even taking into account the 93 additional employees who were added to the staff.  While this falls short of our goal of 90% completion, we did move in a positive direction.  We intend to improve on this trend by  reinforcing follow-up procedures including:  sending the quarterly update on appraisal completions, now sent only to senior managers, to each branch and major unit manager; continuing to send reminders prior to appraisal due dates to all supervisors; and providing another round of Performance Plan and Performance Appraisal training for supervisors who have not taken it.

Metric records each acceptance compared to before when metric recorded each automatic connection.  However, the Increase over projection is probably due to continual general trend of more Wi-Fi ready devices (tablets, smartphones, and e-readers) in the hands of our patrons.

Program: Goal 1: Create a safer transportation experience for everyone
Goal: Objective 1.1: Improve security for transportation system users
Performance Measure: SFPD-reported Muni-related crimes per 100,000 miles
Description: Purpose: To improve security throughout the Muni system by identifying and reducing criminal activity. Definition: The ratio of reported crimes to every 100,000 miles of service.
Technical Description: The number of incidents reported from the SFPD data warehouse are calculated as a ratio to every 100,000 revenue vehicle miles traveled, as reported through the SHOPS database.
FY 2013 Yr End Dept Comment: While the recent trend in personal electronic device thefts has resulted in more reported Muni-related crimes, much of the increase in the incident rate can be attributed to a change in reporting methodology in January 2013, which began the inclusion of Muni-related incidents occurring at stops and stations. Prior to this reporting change, incidents that did not occur on vehicles were not reported.

Program: Goal 1: Create a safer transportation experience for everyone
Goal: Objective 1.2: Improve workplace safety and security
Performance Measure: Workplace injuries per 200,000 hours
Description: Purpose: To improve workplace safety by tracking and reducing workplace injuries. Definition: The ratio of work-related injuries to every 200,000 work hours.
Technical Description: Data on injuries are reported from the workers compensation claims database and calculated as a ratio to every 200,000 work hours.
FY 2013 Yr End Dept Comment: SFMTA incurred 561 new workers compensation claims in FY13, approximately 10% fewer than the 620 incurred FY12.

Program: Goal 1: Create a safer transportation experience for everyone
Goal: Objective 1.3: Improve the safety of the transportation system
Performance Measure: Muni collisions per 100,000 vehicle miles
Description: Purpose:  To reduce accidents through effective operator training programs as well as effective accident follow-up training. Definition:  Track reduction in accidents as a result of more effective operator training and accident retraining.  Data include Federal Transit Administration reportable collisions.
Technical Description: Method:  Number of reportable revenue service collisions divided by revenue miles. Data will be reported to the Board on a quarterly basis. Timeframe: Data is available approximately 60 days after the each quarter closes. The annual goal for the forthcoming fiscal year is traditionally approved by the SFMTA Board of Directors in April or May. Service Standards Cross-Reference: C4
FY 2013 Yr End Dept Comment: While there have been month-to-month and variations in total Muni collisions per 100,000 miles traveled, the rate has remained fairly constant over the past few years. SFMTA staff are continually analyzing data to determine which corridors have the highest number of collisions and identify potential modifications that could improve system safety.

Program: Goal 2: Make transit, walking, bicycling, taxi, ridesharing & carsharing the preferred means of travel
Goal: Objective 2.1: Improve customer service and communications
Performance Measure: Customer rating: Overall customer satisfaction with bicycle network; scale of 1 (low) to 5 (high)
Description: Purpose: To improve customer satisfaction and increase mode share through effective reporting, analysis and planning. Definition: Customer rating on a 1 (low) to 5 (high) scale of overall satisfaction with bicycle network.
Technical Description: Results from quarterly customer satisfaction surveys are reported as an average score on a 1 (low) to 5 (high) scale. Results are based on a non-probability sample from opt-in SFMTA online panel surveys.

Technical Description: Results from quarterly customer satisfaction surveys are reported as an average score on a 1 (low) to 5 (high) scale. Results are based on a non-probability sample from opt-in SFMTA online panel surveys.
